scraped_articles.title: 45 Funny New Year Quotes to Kickstart 2025 With Laughter
scraped_articles.meta_description: Read these funny New Year quotes to welcome 2025 with joy and laughter.
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: funny new year quotes,new year quotes,funny quotes about new year
scraped_articles.content:
45 Funny New Year Quotes to Kickstart 2025 With Laughter

Are you looking for some funny lines to welcome the new year? If you want to make your celebrations more joyful, funny New Year quotes can be a great way to add some laughter to the occasion. You can share them with friends, family, or on social media to bring smiles and spread good vibes.

New Year is the time to share joy and laughter with everyone around us. Sharing funny New Year quotes can help everyone feel connected and create new, joyful memories. Laughter is a great way to start fresh and inspire positivity in the coming months.

In this article, we have selected some of the best, funny New Year quotes from various sources, Tuesday (30/12/2024). Let's welcome the New Year with a big smile on our faces!

Funny New Year Quotes That Will Make You Laugh

1. "Youth is when you're allowed to stay up late on New Year's Eve. Middle age is when you're forced to." - Bill Vaughn

2. "I would say, 'Happy New Year,' but it's not happy; it's exactly the same as last year except colder." - Robert Clark

3. "Happy New Year! It is midnight already, and you are getting old—just go to sleep!" - Unknown

4. "New Year's is just a holiday created by calendar companies who don't want you reusing last year's calendars." - Unknown

5. "Cheers to a new year and another chance for us to get it right." - Oprah Winfrey

6. "An optimist stays up until midnight to see the New Year in. A pessimist stays up to make sure the old year leaves." - Bill Vaughn

7. "New Year's Day is every man's birthday." - Charles Lamb

8. "For last year's words belong to last year's language. And next year's words await another voice – hopefully with fewer typos this time." - T.S. Eliot

9. "I was going to quit all my bad habits for the new year, but nobody likes a quitter." - Unknown

10. "'Out with the old, in with the new' is a fitting expression for a holiday that is based on vomiting." - Andy Borowitz

11. "Every New Year's I have the same question: 'How did I get home?'" - Melanie White

12. "If you want an interesting party, combine cocktails and a fresh box of crayons for everyone." - Robert Fulghum

13. "Be at war with your vices, at peace with your neighbors, and let every new year find you a better man." - Benjamin Franklin

14. "Every new year is the direct descendant, isn't it, of a long line of proven criminals?" - Ogden Nash

15. "Never tell your resolution beforehand, or it's twice as onerous a duty." - John Selden

Funny New Year Resolution Quotes That Are Relatable

1. "Last year's resolution was to lose 20 pounds by Christmas. Only 30 pounds to go." - Unknown

2. "May the New Year bring you courage to break your resolutions early! My own plan is to swear off every kind of virtue, so that I triumph even when I fall." - Aleister Crowley

3. "Now is the accepted time to make your regular annual good resolutions. Next week you can begin paving hell with them as usual." - Mark Twain

4. "New Year's Resolution: To tolerate fools more gladly, provided this does not encourage them to take up more of my time." - James Agate

5. "May all your troubles last as long as your New Year's resolutions." - Joey Lauren Adams

6. "Many years ago I resolved never to bother with New Year's resolutions, and I've stuck with it ever since." - Dave Beard

7. "My New Year's resolution was to stop saying 'You go, girl' to myself." - Zach Galifianakis

8. "My New Year's resolution is to stop lying to myself about making lifestyle changes." - Unknown

9. "My New Year's resolution list usually starts with the desire to lose between 10 and 3,000 pounds." - Nia Vardalos

10. "Good resolutions are simply checks that men draw on a bank where they have no account." - Oscar Wilde

11. "Making resolutions is a cleansing ritual of self-assessment and repentance that demands personal honesty and, ultimately, reinforces humility. Breaking them is part of the cycle." - Eric Zorn

12. "I think in terms of the day's resolutions, not the years'." - Henry Moore

13. "Many years ago, I made a New Year's resolution to never make New Year's resolutions. Hell, it's been the only resolution I've ever kept!" - D.S. Mixell

14. "If I had a dollar for every failed resolution, I'd be rich enough to skip making one this year." - Unknown

15. "They say New Year's resolutions are like babies… fun to make but hard to maintain." - Unknown

More Funny New Year Quotes to Make You Smile

1. "If you decide to cut something out this year, try replacing it with something else to balance out the loss. If you stop drinking soda, for example, replace it with becoming more sedentary. You deserve it. You loved soda." - Colin Nissan

2. "Have a carefree New Year's Eve and a hangover-free New Year's Day." - Unknown

3. "You know how I always dread the whole year? Well, this time I'm only going to dread one day at a time." - Charlie Brown

4. "The funniest part of a new year is making new resolutions. I am pretty sure you have one too. Let me know about your resolution, and I'll try not to laugh as I did in the last year." - Unknown

5. "My resolution was to read more, so I put the subtitles on my TV." - Unknown

6. "My goal for 2025 is to accomplish the goals of 2024, which I should have done in 2023, because I made a promise in 2022 and planned in 2021!" - Unknown

7. "'Out with the old, in with the new' is a fitting expression for a holiday that is based on vomiting." - Andy Borowitz

8. "It wouldn't be New Year's if I didn't have regrets." - William Thomas

9. "I can't believe it's been a year since I didn't become a better person." - Unknown

10. "I'm a little bit older, a little bit wiser, a little bit rounder, but still none the wiser." - Robert Paul

11. "So tonight I'm going to party like it's 1999." - Prince

12. "He who breaks a resolution is a weakling; he who makes one is a fool." - Farquhar McGillivray Knowles

13. "Let's not spend New Year's Eve trying to figure out where to spend New Year's Eve." - Unknown

14. "A New Year's resolution is something that goes in one year and out the other." - Unknown

15. "Stir the eggnog, lift the toddy, Happy New Year everybody." - Phyllis McGinley

scraped_articles.title: 5 Fun Things To Do In Kansas For First-Timers
scraped_articles.meta_description: From visiting world-class museums in Wichita to driving along the legendary Route 66, here are the best things to do in Kansas for first-timers.
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: Things To Do In Kansas,Places To Visit In Kansas,Kansas
scraped_articles.content:
5 Fun Things To Do In Kansas For First-Timers

5 Fun Things To Do In Kansas For First-Timers

If you're planning a trip to Kansas for the first time, you're in for a treat! With so many fun things to do in Kansas, this beautiful state is a wonderful place to explore. Whether you're a history buff, an outdoor enthusiast, or a foodie, there's something for everyone in the Sunflower State.

When it comes to things to do in Kansas, you won't be disappointed. From vibrant art scenes to delicious barbecues, you'll find plenty to keep you entertained. Whether you're exploring the iconic landmarks or discovering hidden gems, the state has something for everyone.

In this article, we'll take a look at some of the best things to do in Kansas for first-timers, according to various sources, (Friday (9/2/2024).

So, get ready to pack your bags and head to Kansas for a first-time adventure you won't forget!

1. Explore World-Class Museums In Wichita

Wichita, Kansas, is home to some world-class museums that are worth exploring. From art and history to interactive exhibits, there is something for everyone to enjoy. From art and history to science and exploration, the museums in Wichita have it all.

One of the most popular museums is the Wichita Art Museum, which features a diverse collection of American art. Another must-see is the Museum of World Treasures, where you can explore artifacts from all over the world, including dinosaur fossils and ancient Egyptian mummies.

If you're interested in science and innovation, be sure to visit the Exploration Place. It's an interactive science center that offers hands-on exhibits and engaging activities for all ages.

Kansas is known for its wide-open spaces and natural beauty, and one of the best ways to experience this is by visiting the Monument Rocks. These amazing rock formations, also known as the Chalk Pyramids, are located in western Kansas and are a must-see for anyone visiting the area.

2. Enjoy The Beauty Of Monument Rocks

The Monument Rocks are made of chalk and stand tall against the backdrop of the Kansas prairie. They were formed over millions of years through the process of erosion, leaving behind towering spires and unique formations that are a sight to behold.

Visitors can explore the area around the rocks and take in the stunning views of the surrounding landscape. It's a great place for photography, as the contrast between the white rocks and the blue sky creates a beautiful and captivating scene.

3. Visit The Eisenhower Presidential Library

Located in Abilene, the Eisenhower Presidential Library is a must-see destination for history enthusiasts and anyone interested in learning about the life and legacy of the 34th President of the United States, Dwight D. Eisenhower.

The library houses a vast collection of documents, photographs, and artifacts that provide insight into Eisenhower's military career, presidency, and personal life. Visitors can explore exhibits that cover his early years, his time as Supreme Allied Commander during World War II, his two terms as President, and his retirement years. The museum also features interactive displays and educational programs that bring Eisenhower's story to life.

In addition to the library and museum, the campus includes Eisenhower's boyhood home. It's the house where he grown up and lived with his family from 1898 to 1911.

4. Going Back To The Old West At Dodge City

If you're a fan of the Old West, then a visit to Dodge City is a must. This historic town in Kansas is known for its rich history and connection to the era of cowboys, outlaws, and gunfights.

When you step into Dodge City, it's like taking a trip back in time. The town has preserved many of its historic buildings, giving visitors a glimpse into life in the 1800s. You can visit places like Boot Hill Museum, where you can see artifacts from the Old West and learn about famous outlaws like Jesse James and Wyatt Earp.

Whether you're a history buff or just someone looking for a unique and memorable experience, Dodge City offers a chance to step back in time and immerse yourself in the fascinating world of the Old West. With its rich history and engaging attractions, it's a destination that should not be missed.

5. Drive Along The Legendary Kansas Route 66

One of the best things to do in Kansas is to drive along the legendary Route 66. This historic road stretches across the state, offering beautiful views and a glimpse into the past.

As you drive along Route 66 in Kansas, you'll pass through quaint towns, scenic countryside, and iconic landmarks. The road is lined with nostalgic diners, quirky roadside attractions, and vintage signs that harken back to a bygone era.

You can stop at the historic towns of Galena and Baxter Springs to explore their charming Main Streets and learn about the area's rich history. You can also visit the famous Kan-O-Tex Service Station in Galena. This historic gas station has a special connection to the famous Cars movie series by Disney.

scraped_articles.title: Search for Wreck of Merchant Royal Carrying £4 Billion Treasure Begins
scraped_articles.meta_description: Search for Wreck of Merchant Royal Carrying £4 Billion Treasure Begins
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: treasure,el dorado of the sea,ship wreck,caribbean
scraped_articles.content:
Search for Wreck of Merchant Royal Carrying £4 Billion Treasure Begins

Search for Wreck of Merchant Royal Carrying £4 Billion Treasure Begins

The Merchant Royal nicknamed the "El Dorado of the Seas" for its rumored riches, sank off the coast of Cornwall in 1641.

The 17th-century English wreck, laden with £4 billion worth of treasure, has never been found despite centuries of searching.

According to The Metro, a British company equipped with new technology believes they will finally be able to find the elusive wreck.

According to news reports, the Merchant Royal is thought to be carrying billions of pounds worth of gold and silver.

Multibeam Services, a company specializing in finding lost wrecks, will spend 2024 searching a 200-square-mile area of the English Channel.

They will use uncrewed underwater vessels and advanced sonar technology in their search.

The company's leader, Nigel Hodge, emphasized the historical significance of the discovery. He said that the treasure found will be treated as a heritage artifact.

Nigel told The Metro that this is not a gold rush, although he believes the wreck could be worth billions of pounds.

The search is expected to be challenging due to the dangerous waters in which the ship sank.

Nigel explains that the search will be difficult because the waters where the ship sank are very dangerous.

"There are thousands of wrecks out there, and the Merchant Royal is just one of them," he said.

"So we have to really pick out a lot of the wrecks that we're working on and then identify them. It's not easy. If it was easy, it would have been done," Nigel explained, as reported by The Metro.

Based in Redruth and employing several former fishermen, Nigel Hodge is confident that his company is poised for success when others falter.

He believes so because he feels familiar with the local waters and technological advancements.

The shipwreck occurred on September 23, 1641, when the ship was en route to Dartmouth. Before the sinking, the ship had stopped at the port of Cadiz, Spain, to make repairs and load additional cargo on its way home from Mexico and the Caribbean.

"Girl, Interrupted" is a drama about a young woman named Susanna Kaysen, played by Winona Ryder, who checks into a psychiatric hospital in the late 1960s. Angelina Jolie plays Lisa Rowe, a sociopathic patient who befriends Susanna. The film explores the struggles of mental illness and the dynamics within the hospital. Lisa's unpredictable and rebellious nature both fascinates and frightens Susanna. Their friendship is intense and complex, leading to a mix of troubling and enlightening experiences. Months later, the police return a boy they claim is her son, but Christine insists he is not. Determined to find her real son, she faces corruption and obstacles from the authorities. 5. Lara Croft: Tomb Raider (2001)

Lara Croft: Tomb Raider

In "Lara Croft: Tomb Raider," Angelina Jolie stars as Lara Croft, an adventurous archaeologist who travels the world seeking ancient artifacts. The film follows Mariane's search for her husband and her efforts to uncover the truth behind his disappearance. scraped_articles.title: How Many Times Should a Cat Poop in a Day?
scraped_articles.meta_description: Adult cats usually defecate once to three times a day.
scraped_articles.content:
How Many Times Should a Cat Poop in a Day?

Pay attention to the frequency of their bowel movements!

How Many Times Should a Cat Poop in a Day?

Are you worried about your cat's digestion at home?

Pay attention to the frequency of their bowel movements!

If it's normal, your cat is healthy.

Also, pay attention to the color and texture of the litter. The color and texture of your cat's litter can also be an indication of its digestive health.

Normal Frequency of Cat's Bowel Movements

According to DorkyCats, adult cats typically poop once a day.

However, it is still considered normal for cats to defecate up to three times a day.

According to WebMD, cats who poop less than once in 24 hours or more than three times a day may indicate constipation or diarrhea.

The frequency of a cat's bowel movements is not the only indicator of good digestive health.

The consistency, shape, and color of your cat's stool are as important as how often they poop.

Characteristics of Healthy Cat Feces

The following are the characteristics of healthy cat feces.

  1. It is dark brown in color (not black or clay-colored).
  2. It does not contain blood or mucus.
  3. It is neither solid nor soft.
  4. It has a shape similar to a stick or nugget.
  5. It does not contain clumps of hair or other objects.

If a cat's feces look different than usual, it is worth taking the cat to a veterinarian.

It could be that the cat has eaten food that does not agree with its digestion.

Medical conditions such as colitis, gastritis, or ulcers can also affect a cat's feces.

scraped_articles.title: 6 Most Haunted Places In Boston, MA, to Explore the Legends and Lore
scraped_articles.meta_description: Explore the legends and lore of these sites, but be prepared for a scary experience you will remember.
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: Haunted Places In Boston,Most Haunted Places In Boston, MA,Boston, Massachusetts,Massachusetts,Legend,Haunted,paranormal,ghost,scary,horror,United States,America,destination,destinations
scraped_articles.content:
6 Most Haunted Places In Boston, MA, to Explore the Legends and Lore

6 Most Haunted Places In Boston, MA, to Explore the Legends and Lore

Boston, Massachusetts, is known for its rich history and vibrant culture. Boston is also famous for its role in the American Revolution in the late 1700s.

But did you know that the city is also home to some of the most haunted places in the country? It ranges from historic houses to college dormitories. These eerie sites are said to be filled with ghostly spirits and chilling tales. If you're brave enough, discover 6 of the most haunted places in Boston that you can explore.














Most Haunted Places In Boston, MA

flickr/Michelle

1. The Haunted Hooper-Lee-Nichols House

This historic home in Cambridge is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former owner, Mary Lee Nichols. Visitors have reported hearing footsteps and seeing apparitions in the house, which dates back to the 17th century.

Berklee College of Music students have long believed their residence hall is haunted. Legend has it that a former student who tragically died in a car accident still roams the halls. That student often played ghostly melodies on his guitar late at night.

2. Berklee College Residence Hall

3. The George Parkman House

This grand mansion in Beacon Hill was the site of a gruesome murder in 1849. Dr. George Parkman was killed and dismembered by a fellow physician, John White Webster, leading to rumors of paranormal activity in the house. Visitors have reported hearing screams and seeing shadowy figures in the rooms where the murder took place.

flickr/alohadave

4. Fort Warren

Fort Warren is a historic military fort located on George Island in Boston Harbor. It is said to be haunted by the ghost of a Confederate soldier. Legend has it that he roams the grounds at night, searching for his lost comrades from the Civil War.

5. Boylston Street Station

Boylston Street Station is abandoned subway station in Boston.

It is rumored to be haunted by the ghost of a construction worker. He died during its construction in the early 1900s. Visitors have reported hearing strange noises and cold spots while exploring the dark tunnels.

flickr/City of Boston Archives

6. The Pilot House

This waterfront restaurant in Charlestown is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former sea captain who tragically died at sea. Visitors have reported seeing apparitions of a man in an old-fashioned sailor dress and feeling a chill in some restaurant regions.

Whether you're a paranormal buff or looking for a spooky adventure, these haunted places in Boston will bring you to the city's eerie past.

Explore the legends and lore of these sites, but be prepared for a scary experience you will remember. Who knows what ghostly encounters you may have as you enter the haunted history of Boston, Massachusetts.

Most Haunted Places In Boston, MA

scraped_articles.title: 7 Things To Do In Waco: Must-Experience Activities for Every Traveler
scraped_articles.meta_description: Pack your bags and take a journey where every corner tells a new delight.
scraped_articles.content:
7 Things To Do In Waco: Must-Experience Activities for Every Traveler

7 Things To Do In Waco: Must-Experience Activities for Every Traveler

Welcome to Waco, Texas!

This city is filled with exciting attractions and activities that will delight travelers of all ages. Whether you're a history enthusiast, nature lover, or just looking for a unique experience, Waco has something for everyone. This article will explore seven must-experience activities in Waco. These destinations will leave you with unforgettable memories. Waco has everything from exploring ancient mammoth remains to wandering through beautiful vineyards. Let's dive right in!

Things To Do In Waco

1. Waco Mammoth National Monument

One must-visit attraction is the Waco Mammoth National Monument. Step back in time at this monument, where you can see the incredible remains of mammoths.

Take a guided tour and learn about these magnificent creatures that once roamed the earth. It's a truly fascinating experience that will transport you to a different era. Don't forget to visit the exhibits and interactive displays to enhance your understanding of these prehistoric giants further.

Take a relaxing walk across the iconic Waco Suspension Bridge, which spans across the Brazos River.

2. Waco Suspension Bridge

This historic bridge offers breathtaking views of the river and the surrounding cityscape. As you walk, imagine the history and stories that this bridge has witnessed over the years. It's a great spot for a peaceful walk or to snap some amazing photographs.

3. Cameron Park Zoo

Animal lovers rejoice! The Cameron Park Zoo is home to over 1,700 animals worldwide.

Walk through the beautifully landscaped exhibits and get close to fascinating creatures like lions, giraffes, and elephants.

The zoo also offers educational programs and interactive experiences, making it the perfect outing for families with children. Don't miss the opportunity to feed the giraffes or attend a live animal presentation. It's a place where fun and learning come together.

Things To Do In Waco

4. Texas Sports Hall of Fame

Sports enthusiasts will be amazed at the Texas Sports Hall of Fame. This museum shows Texas's rich sports history and honors of its legendary athletes.

Explore shows that highlight various sports, including football, basketball, and baseball.

Learn about iconic athletes like Tom Landry and Babe Didrikson Zaharias, who significantly contributed to their respective sports. Whether you're a die-hard sports fan or just curious about Texas' athletic heritage, this museum is a must-visit.

Things To Do In Waco

valleymillsvineyards.com

5. Valley Mills Vineyards

Indulge in a delightful wine-tasting experience at Valley Mills Vineyards. Nestled in the picturesque countryside of Waco, this winery offers a serene escape from bustling city life. Take a guided vineyard tour and learn about the winemaking process.

You can also savoring the stunning flavors of their award-winning wines. Whether you're a wine specialist or appreciate a good glass of wine, Valley Mills Vineyards is a must-visit destination.

6. Texas Ranger Hall of Fame & Museum

Discover the rich history of the legendary Texas Rangers at the Texas Ranger Hall of Fame & Museum.

This institution pays tribute to the brave men and women who have served as Texas Rangers throughout history.

Explore the displays that show artifacts, weapons, and stories from the Texas Rangers' past. Learn about their law enforcement role and contributions to shaping Texas' history. It's a beautiful journey through time. This museum will leave you with a deep appreciation for these iconic figures.

Things To Do In Waco

7. Magnolia Market in the Silos

No trip to Waco would be complete without visiting Magnolia Market at the Silos.

It's made famous by Chip and Joanna Gaines from the popular HGTV show "Fixer Upper." This trendy shopping destination uniquely blends home decor, clothing, and accessories. Explore the carefully curated shops, and grab a bite to eat at one of the food trucks. You can also relax on the sprawling lawn while enjoying live music. Magnolia Market is where creativity and style converge, offering inspiration for your home and wardrobe.

In the heart of Texas, Waco invites you to must-experience activities for every traveler.

It ranges from exploring historic landmarks to nature and enjoying unique shopping experiences. There's something for everyone in Waco. Whether you're seeking a dose of history, outdoor adventures, or a restful shopping day, Waco has it all. So, pack your bags and take a journey where every corner tells a new delight. It makes Waco a destination that promises fantastic memories for all.

Things To Do In Waco

Here's Where to Buy Taylor Swift Vancouver Eras Tour Tickets Online

Taylor Swift's highly anticipated Eras Tour will conclude with three shows in Vancouver at BC Place Stadium. This tour will held from December 6 to December 8, 2024.

Here's everything you need to know about getting tickets to this spectacular event.

Ticket Purchase Options

Fans can buy tickets through various platforms, including:

  1. StubHub
  2. Vivid Seats
  3. Ticketmaster

Ticket Prices

Prices for the Vancouver show vary significantly:

  1. December 6: Starting at approximately $1,790
  2. December 7: Starting at around $1,557
  3. December 8: Starting at about $1,790

However, ticket prices can spike, with some listings as high as $12,000 for premium seats near the stage.

Venue Information

BC Place has a capacity of approximately 54,500. This location is famous as a venue for large events. Seating arrangements offer a variety of options. Floor seats start at about $6,000 and seats with a straight view of section 454 cost more than $3,000.

scraped_articles.title: 500+ Best Truth or Drink Questions for Unforgettable Game Nights
scraped_articles.meta_description: Unlike the classic Truth or Dare game from high school, this grown-up version gives players a simple choice.
scraped_articles.content:
500+ Best Truth or Drink Questions for Unforgettable Game Nights

Truth or Drink is the perfect adult party game that combines honesty with a bit of liquid courage. Unlike the classic Truth or Dare game from high school, this grown-up version gives players a simple choice: answer truthfully or take a drink. It’s a fantastic way to learn surprising things about your friends, break the ice at parties, or deepen connections with your partner.

Whether you’re looking for light-hearted fun or want to dive into deeper conversations, Truth or Drink offers something for everyone. The beauty of this game lies in its simplicity and flexibility – you can play it with just two people or a large group, and adjust the questions to match the mood and comfort level of your gathering.

In this wide guide, we’ve compiled over 500 Truth or Drink questions across various categories – from funny and light-hearted to deep and personal, from spicy questions for friends to intimate ones for couples. So grab your favorite drinks, gather your friends or partner, and get ready for an unforgettable game night!

How to Play Truth or Drink

The rules of Truth or Drink are refreshingly simple, making it perfect for any adult gathering. Here’s how to play:

1. Gather at least two or more people and make sure everyone has a drink. You can use beer, wine, cocktails, or even non-alcoholic options for those who prefer not to drink alcohol.

2. Decide how much alcohol people should drink if they choose not to answer a question. This could be a full shot or just a sip, depending on how challenging your questions are.

3. Choose who goes first. You can do this randomly by spinning a bottle, flipping a coin, or simply picking the bravest person in the group.

4. The first player asks a Truth or Drink question to another player. You can use questions from our list or come up with your own.

5. The person who was asked the question has two choices: answer honestly or take a drink to avoid answering.

6. After answering (or drinking), that person gets to ask the next question to someone else in the group.

7. Continue until everyone has had their turn or until you’ve had enough fun (or drinks)!

For a more organized approach, you can write questions on index cards and shuffle them, with each player drawing a card and either answering the question or taking a drink. You can also incorporate Truth or Drink into other drinking games – for example, if you’re playing Kings Cup, make players answer a Truth or Drink question when they pull a certain card.

Remember to play responsibly! Never pressure anyone to drink if they don’t want to, and make sure everyone has a safe way to get home if alcohol is involved. The goal is to have fun and create memorable experiences, not to make anyone uncomfortable.

Fun Truth or Drink Questions for Friends

These fun questions are perfect for breaking the ice and getting everyone laughing. They’re not too personal but still interesting enough to reveal some entertaining facts about your friends.

1. What was the last thing you lied about?

2. If you could be any celebrity, who would it be and why?

3. What’s the craziest thing you’ve ever done that you don’t regret?

4. What’s your weirdest habit that you do when no one is watching?

5. Have you ever had a crush on someone in this room?

6. What’s the most embarrassing thing your parents have caught you doing?

7. What’s the most ridiculous fashion trend you’ve ever followed?

8. Have you ever used a fake ID? What happened?

9. What’s the worst gift you’ve ever given or received?

10. What’s the guilty pleasure song that you’d never admit to liking?

11. Have you ever had a crush on your friend’s partner?

12. What’s the most embarrassing thing you’ve ever Googled?

13. Have you ever sent a text to the wrong person by accident? What was it?

14. What’s the silliest fear you still have as an adult?

15. Have you ever been caught doing something you shouldn’t in public?

16. What’s the strangest food combination you secretly enjoy?

17. Have you ever had a crush on a fictional character? Who?

18. What’s the most embarrassing thing you’ve done on social media?

19. Have you ever cheated during a game and got away with it?

20. What’s the most outrageous dare you’ve ever accepted?

21. Have you ever snooped through someone else’s phone?

22. What’s the most embarrassing nickname you’ve been given?

23. Have you ever faked being sick to get out of something?

24. What’s the most cringe-worthy pick-up line you’ve used or heard?

25. Have you ever accidentally insulted someone to their face?

26. What’s the weirdest place you’ve ever fallen asleep?

Conclusion

Truth or Drink is more than just a drinking game – it’s a fantastic way to create memorable experiences with friends and loved ones. Whether you’re looking to break the ice at a party, get to know new friends better, or deepen your connection with your partner, this game offers endless possibilities for fun, laughter, and meaningful conversations.

With over 500 questions across various categories – from light-hearted and funny to deep and personal, from spicy questions for friends to intimate ones for couples – you now have a comprehensive collection to choose from for any occasion. Remember to always respect everyone’s boundaries and comfort levels, and never pressure anyone to drink or answer questions they’re not comfortable with.

The beauty of Truth or Drink lies in its simplicity and flexibility. You can adjust the questions and rules to suit your group’s preferences, making it perfect for any adult gathering. So gather your friends, pour your favorite drinks, and get ready for an unforgettable game night filled with surprising revelations, hearty laughs, and deeper connections.

Whether you choose to tell the truth or take a drink, one thing is certain – you’re in for a fun and memorable experience that will bring you closer to the people you’re playing with. Cheers to unforgettable moments and the truths (or drinks) that bring us together!

scraped_articles.title: 5 Most Depressing Video Games That Will Break Your Heart
scraped_articles.meta_description: These games create an impactful and emotionally draining experience, making players feel a deep sense of sadness.
scraped_articles.content:
5 Most Depressing Video Games That Will Break Your Heart

These games create an impactful and emotionally draining experience, making players feel a deep sense of sadness.

5 Most Depressing Video Games That Will Break Your Heart

The Last of Us

The Last of Us is widely known for its emotionally intense and often depressing storyline. Set in a post-apocalyptic world where a fungal infection has turned most of humanity into violent, zombie-like creatures, the game follows Joel and Ellie, two survivors trying to navigate the ruined world.

Themes of loss, survival, and the breakdown of human morality are central, and the relationship between Joel and Ellie, built on trauma and tragedy, makes the game's ending particularly haunting. Its exploration of grief, sacrifice, and the ethical dilemmas of survival leaves players emotionally drained.

Spec Ops: The Line

On the surface, Spec Ops: The Line may appear to be a typical military shooter, but as the story unfolds, it becomes a disturbing exploration of the horrors of war, psychological trauma, and moral degradation.

The game puts players in impossible situations where every choice seems wrong, leading to harrowing consequences. As the protagonist, Captain Walker, spirals into madness, the lines between hero and villain blur, culminating in a bleak realization about the consequences of his actions.

The game forces players to confront the darker aspects of warfare and the human psyche, making it a profoundly depressing experience.

That Dragon, Cancer

That Dragon, Cancer is an autobiographical game created by Ryan and Amy Green about their real-life experience with their son Joel, who was diagnosed with terminal cancer.

The game takes players through various stages of Joel’s illness, from moments of hope to devastating setbacks, ultimately focusing on the emotional turmoil of watching a loved one slowly die.

With its personal, raw narrative and its exploration of faith, love, and loss, That Dragon, Cancer is a deeply emotional game that leaves players reflecting on life, death, and grief long after the credits roll.

Silent Hill 2

Silent Hill 2 is one of the most haunting and psychologically disturbing games ever made. The story follows James Sunderland, who arrives in the eerie town of Silent Hill after receiving a letter from his deceased wife.

As James navigates the nightmarish landscape, the game delves into themes of guilt, loss, and trauma. The disturbing atmosphere, horrifying creatures, and the psychological unraveling of James' mind all contribute to a sense of hopelessness and dread.

The game's multiple endings only add to the emotional weight, each one offering a bleak or ambiguous conclusion.

Life Is Strange

Life is Strange is a narrative-driven game that focuses on the life of Max Caulfield, a high school student with the power to rewind time. The game explores heavy themes such as bullying, depression, suicide, and grief.

One of the most emotionally intense moments occurs when Max is forced to confront the possibility of losing her best friend, Chloe, multiple times throughout the game. The choices Max makes throughout the story often lead to difficult moral dilemmas, and the game's final decision is particularly heart-wrenching, as it asks players to sacrifice either Chloe or the entire town. Life is Strange leaves players emotionally conflicted, with no happy resolution.

scraped_articles.title: Why Adolf Hitler Groomed His Unique and Iconic Toothbrush-Shaped Mustache
scraped_articles.meta_description: Why Adolf Hitler Groomed His Unique and Iconic Toothbrush-Shaped Mustache
scraped_articles.content:
Why Adolf Hitler Groomed His Unique and Iconic Toothbrush-Shaped Mustache

Why Adolf Hitler Groomed His Unique and Iconic Toothbrush-Shaped Mustache

Hitler's uniquely shaped mustache has made his figure even more iconic.

The box-shaped mustache attached to him has its history behind it.

As reported by The Daily Star, based on a series produced by the History Channel, Hitler had to shape his mustache to wear a gas mask properly during his involvement in World War I. This is because when he still had a long mustache with long ends, he could not wear it. This is because when he still had a long mustache with a twisted end, his gas mask could not be tightly closed when dealing with a gas attack.

Gas masks or respirators were an essential part of the German armor at the time due to the threat of gas attacks from the British in 1918, which were sprayed continuously.


Eventually, the young Adolf Hitler character in the series trimmed it down to the boxy shape many people are familiar with today.

However, Stephen David, executive producer of the series, said that his research team learned that Hitler preferred a long mustache before World War I broke out.

The toothbrush mustache was introduced in Germany in the late 19th century after visiting America.

According to another source, Adolf Hitler's sister-in-law, Bridget Hitler, is known to have fought with him because she couldn't stand the mustache and persuaded him to cut it off.

In 1923, his future publicist Ernst Hanfstaengl, who later adopted the style, advised him to remove his toothbrush mustache. But Hitler replied, "If this is not fashionable now, it will be fashionable later because I wear it."

Apart from Adolf Hitler, the figures around him also adopted a similar style.

Hitler's mentor, Anton Drexler, wears a notched version of the toothbrush mustache.

Then Friedrich Kellner, a Social Democrat who campaigned against Hitler, also wore the style.

In addition, many Nazi figures other than Hitler had similar mustaches, including Heinrich Himmler, Karl Holz, Ernst Röhm, and Hitler's driver, Julius Schreck.

Comedian Charlie Chaplin was even known to have the same mustache style.

On June 9, 2024, aespa's Karina attended the second game of the SSG Landers vs. Lotte Giants doubleheader at Sajik Stadium in Busan.

When Karina threw out the first pitch, the seat rate at the stadium jumped to '90.13%' for the three-game weekend series. Here is Karina's proof of effect.

Not only the audience, the game commentators were also mesmerized by Karina's visuals. In fact, they even mentioned Karina's name as a player in this match.

"We are also very excited. Karina's player has gotten the attention of both teams' players,” said the commentator ahead of the match.

The match live chat on social media was also flooded with comments about Karina. It was as if everyone was looking forward to her performance.

Karina's stylish first-pitch look was the first thing that caught the public's attention. The idol wore a Lotte Giants uniform paired with jeans.

Karina also went viral for her excellent first pitch. Without needing to show much movement, Karina threw the ball perfectly into the catcher's glove.

Karina's historic throw was uploaded on the official YouTube of the Korean Baseball Organization (KBO) for aespa fans and baseball fans around the world to watch.

Seeing the public's enthusiasm for Karina's performance, fans are happy because more and more people support and give a lot of love to the 'Supernova' singer.

scraped_articles.title: 5 Fun Things To Do In Utah With Kids And Family
scraped_articles.meta_description: Here are some fun things to do in Utah for kids to make your family vacation unforgettable.
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: Things To Do in Utah for Kids,Things To Do In Utah,Fun Things To Do In Utah,Utah,Things To Do
scraped_articles.content:
5 Fun Things To Do In Utah With Kids And Family

Are you going to bring your kids on a vacation to Utah? If so, you're going to need our list of the best things to do in Utah for family and kids! (Photo by Alex Azabache on Unsplash)

5 Fun Things To Do In Utah With Kids And Family

Utah: A Perfect Place For Family Vacation

Utah is a beautiful state located in the Western US. The state's diverse and breathtaking landscapes and long history have charmed many curious travelers to come.

Utah offers a wide range of activities suitable for everyone, including children. From exploring its beautiful nature to having fun at an indoor skydiving facility, there are many things to do in Utah that offer kids unforgettable experiences.

In this article, we will uncover some fun things to do in Utah for kids and family, as selected from various sources, on Monday (28/8/2023). Without further ado, let's go!

(Photo by Taylor Brandon on Unsplash)

Zion National Park is the gateway to the breathtaking landscapes of Utah. This beautiful national park is located in southern Utah. This park features a diverse landscape, from sandstone cliffs and narrow canyons to lush valleys and the winding Virgin River. (Photo by Alex Donnachie on Unsplash)

1. Explore The Beauty Of Zion National Park

Zion National Park is a perfect place for anyone who wants to get close to nature. It's the perfect place to have a little bit of adventure with your family and children.

(Photo by Danika Perkinson on Unsplash)

The park features many hiking trails with various levels of difficulty. Some of them are easy enough for children, making them perfect for a family adventure.

Some kid-friendly hiking trails in Zion National Park are the Lower Emerald Pool Trail, Pa'rus Trail, and Grotto Trail.

© 2023 trstdly.com

You can also grab some food at the restaurants or grocery store and have a good time at the picnic areas located in the park. Overall, Zion National Park is a good place to show your children and let them learn the beauty of nature in Utah.

(Photo by Jeremy Bishop on Unsplash)

2. Meet Dinosaurs At Ogden's George S. Eccles Dinosaur Park

There's no kid who doesn't love dinosaurs. These giant ancient creatures have always been a child's fantasy. If your kids love dinosaurs, you can take them to the George S. Eccles Dinosaur Park. It is located in the city of Ogden, Utah. (Photo from Instagram @ogdendinosaurpark)

The George S. Eccles Dinosaur Park is a great place for children. It's a place where your children can learn about dinosaurs and have fun at the same time.

The park features many life-size replicas of various dinosaurs that ever roam on Earth. The replicas are made based on real fossils, so they look like the real ones. Overall, it's a great place for them to learn about dinosaurs, their history, their habitat, and their extinction.

3. Visit The Hill Aerospace Museum

Kids love many cool things, and aircraft is one of them. You can take your kids to the Hill Aerospace Museum so they can learn more about aerospace and its history. (Photo from www.aerospaceutah.org)

The Hill Aerospace Museum is located in Hill Air Force Base, Utah. It's a great museum featuring over 70 cool aircraft from various periods. From the Wright brothers' era to modern aircraft, you can find them all in this museum.

(Photo from Instagram @aerospaceutah)

Visiting iFLY is one of the best things to do in Utah for kids and families. It offers an unforgettable experience for your children. (Photo from Instagram @iflyutah)

4. Try Skydiving At iFLY Utah

iFLY Utah: Indoor Skydiving Experience

iFLY Utah is an indoor skydiving facility in Salt Lake City. It offers the sensation of freefalling in a controlled wind tunnel.

It's safe for all ages, including children, since you'll be guided by experienced instructors. You can experience the excitement of flying without needing a plane or parachute.

The Discovery Gateway Children's Museum is a heaven for children. It's a place where your kids can learn and develop various skills while having fun at the same time. (Photo from Instagram @discoverygateway)

5. Learn At The Discovery Gateway Children's Museum

At the museum, they have different areas where you can explore lots of interesting subjects. There are places where you can experiment with water, create art, pretend to be a scientist, and even learn about faraway places and different cultures.

(Photo from Instagram @discoverygateway)

If you want your vacation to be useful as well as fun for your children, visiting the Discovery Gateway Children's Museum is a must.

(Photo from Instagram @discoverygateway)

scraped_articles.title: What Is A Narcissistic? Understanding The Definition And Signs Of Narcissism
scraped_articles.meta_description: What is a narcissistic? Here is the definition and the signs of a narcissist.
scraped_articles.meta_keywords: What Is A Narcissistic,Narcissism,Signs Of Narcissism
scraped_articles.content:
What Is A Narcissistic? Understanding The Definition And Signs Of Narcissism

Today, in the golden era of social media, we often hear the term "narcissistic." But have you ever wondered what is a narcissistic person?

What Is A Narcissistic

In a world where self-expression and individuality are celebrated, it's important to draw a fine line between confidence and narcissism. We've all met people who seem to think they're super important, constantly seek praise from others, and lack empathy for others. But what exactly is a narcissistic person, and how can we identify the signs?

In this article, we will try to answer the question, "What is a narcissistic person?" We will also share some signs of narcissism, as collected from other sources, Friday (17/11/2023). Whether you're teaming up on a project, hanging out with friends, or getting close to someone special, knowing the signs of narcissistic behavior helps you build better connections.

A. What Is A Narcissistic Person?

A narcissistic person is someone who has an excessive sense of self-importance, a constant need for admiration, and a lack of empathy for others.

There are various levels of narcissism, but overall, narcissistic people tend to believe they are unique and superior to others.

They may exaggerate their achievements and talents while expecting special treatment and unquestioning compliance from those around them.

Narcissism is a bad behavior since it can potentially cause harm to other people. Since narcissists prioritize their own needs and desires over those of others, they may exploit or manipulate people to achieve their goals. This behavior can lead to unhealthy power dynamics, where the narcissistic individual dominates and controls the relationship.

Their lack of empathy can result in emotional neglect or even abuse, as they may struggle to understand or care about the feelings of others.

Narcissism can make it hard to have a genuine relationship with others. Their constant need for admiration may lead to shallow relationships built on validation rather than mutual understanding.

Furthermore, the inability to empathize can make it challenging for them to maintain healthy interactions, as they may struggle to comprehend the perspectives and emotions of those around them.

B. 7 Signs Of A Narcissistic

1. Constant Need for Attention and Admiration

A key trait of narcissism is a continuous need for attention and admiration. People with narcissistic tendencies crave constant validation from others. They may fish for compliments, boast about their achievements, or exaggerate their talents to ensure they remain the center of attention. This never-ending quest for admiration can be exhausting for those around them.

2. Lack of Empathy

Empathy, the ability to understand and share the feelings of others, is often lacking in narcissistic individuals. They may struggle to recognize or be indifferent to the emotions of those around them. This lack of empathy can lead to difficulties in forming genuine connections, as they may not fully grasp or care about the impact of their actions on others.

Narcissists often have an exaggerated sense of entitlement. They believe they deserve special treatment and that others should cater to their needs without question. This entitlement can manifest in demanding preferential treatment, exploiting others for personal gain, or expecting unwavering compliance with their wishes.

3. Sense of Entitlement

4. Exploitative Behavior: Narcissistic individuals may exploit others to achieve their own goals. This can involve manipulating people or taking advantage of their trust and goodwill. They might use charm, deception, or coercion to get what they want, often without regard for the well-being of those they manipulate.

5. Difficulty Accepting Criticism: Criticism, even if constructive, is often met with resistance or defensiveness by narcissistic individuals. They may struggle to accept that they are not perfect and resist acknowledging any flaws or shortcomings. This defensiveness can hinder personal and professional growth, as it prevents them from learning and adapting.

6. Intense Reaction to Perceived Criticism or Rejection: Narcissists can react strongly to perceived criticism or rejection. Minor feedback that others might take in stride can provoke intense emotional reactions in individuals with narcissistic tendencies. This hypersensitivity can lead to anger, resentment, or even retaliation against those they see as threats to their self-esteem.

7. Difficulty Maintaining Healthy Relationships: Due to their self-centered nature and lack of empathy, narcissistic individuals often struggle to maintain healthy relationships. Their focus on their own needs and desires can hinder the development of meaningful connections, leading to shallow or one-sided relationships.

How to choose the latest bridesmaid dress in 2024 accurately.

Latest Bridesmaid Dress Model 2024, Tips for Choosing the Right One

Giving ready-to-wear dresses to bridesmaids is more practical than giving them fabric. They don't have to sew it themselves.

Choosing a bridesmaid dress is easy.

scraped_articles.title: 6 Creepiest Haunted Places in Dubai
scraped_articles.meta_description: 6 Creepiest Haunted Places in Dubai; from old palace to suicide gate!
scraped_articles.content:
6 Creepiest Haunted Places in Dubai

6 Creepiest Haunted Places in Dubai

Dubai is a city known for its glitz and glamour, but did you know it also has some really spooky places? We've gathered a list of six creepy spots that might give you goosebumps. Whether you believe in ghosts or just enjoy a good scare, these haunted places in Dubai have stories that will make your spine tingle.

Al Jazirat Al Hamra: The Ghost Town of Dubai

An hour from Dubai is Al Jazirat Al Hamra, a deserted town with spooky stories. Locals warn against going there after dark. It's a ghost town with abandoned houses, holding a mysterious past.

Al Khail Gate: The Suicidal Spot

Al Khail Gate, finished in 2011, is eerie. Residents left in six days due to strange happenings like things moving on their own. Some heard moans, and a few suicides occurred. The place is abandoned and haunted, telling a chilling story.

Al Qasimi Palace: Ghost Ruin

Half an hour from Dubai, Al Qasimi Palace is now a haunted ruin. People talk about hearing children playing and seeing ghosts. Locals advise staying away due to the unsettling tales surrounding the palace.

Jumeirah: The Devil’s House

In Jumeirah, a seven-bedroom house gained infamy as the "Devil’s House." The Filipino occupants left in 2011, reporting ghostly sightings. Locals warn it has a negative energy, urging people to stay away.

Pan Emirates Tunnel: The Haunted Tunnel

The Pan Emirates Tunnel in Dubai is a spooky place. People feel scared inside, sensing someone's presence. Some even say they've seen ghosts. It's a top haunted spot for those seeking a scary experience.

Sharjah: Al Dahid Road

Sharjah's Al Dahid Road became known after a viral photo showed a scary woman. Experts say it's real. The haunting story adds mystery to the road, making it spooky for those interested in the paranormal.

scraped_articles.title: Ultimate Guide to Morning Meeting Questions for Students
scraped_articles.meta_description: This comprehensive guide provides educators with a diverse collection of morning meeting questions suitable for students of all ages.
scraped_articles.content:
Ultimate Guide to Morning Meeting Questions for Students

Morning meetings have become an essential part of many classrooms, creating a positive start to the school day and building a strong sense of community. At the heart of effective morning meetings are thoughtful, engaging questions that encourage students to share, reflect, and connect with one another. This comprehensive guide provides educators with a diverse collection of morning meeting questions suitable for students of all ages, from kindergarten through high school.

Understanding the Importance of Morning Meetings

Morning meetings serve as a powerful transition tool, helping students shift from home to school mode. These brief gatherings set the tone for the entire learning experience, fostering communication, building relationships, and nurturing a strong classroom community.

Effective morning meetings offer numerous benefits:

• Social-emotional learning: Sharing experiences and feelings encourages self-reflection and empathy among students.

• Positive classroom environment: Fun and interactive questions create a welcoming space where students feel comfortable to participate.

• Community building: Regular meetings allow students to connect with each other and build strong relationships.

• Teacher assessment: Questions can provide insights into student well-being and identify potential areas where support is needed.

Morning meetings typically include several components: a greeting, sharing time, a group activity, and a morning message. The questions we’ll explore can be incorporated into the sharing portion of your meeting, serving as conversation starters that engage students and encourage meaningful discussion.

Morning Meeting Questions for Elementary Students

Elementary school is a critical time for developing social skills and building classroom community. These questions are designed to be accessible and engaging for younger students while encouraging them to share their thoughts and experiences.

Questions for Kindergarten and First Grade

For our youngest learners, simple questions that relate to their immediate experiences work best:

• What’s your favorite thing to do on the playground?

• Did you have any fun dreams last night?

• What’s your favorite color and why?

• Can you tell us about something kind you did yesterday?

• What’s your favorite animal and why?

• What’s your favorite book to read before bed?

• What’s something you’re looking forward to today?

• What’s your favorite thing about yourself?

• Can you tell us about a time when you felt really happy?

• What’s your favorite song to sing or dance to?

Questions for Second and Third Grade

As students develop more self-awareness and communication skills, questions can become slightly more complex:

• What’s something that made you smile yesterday?

• If you could choose any animal as a class pet, what would it be and why?

• What’s one thing you’re proud of accomplishing this week?

• What’s your favorite subject in school and why?

• Can you tell us about a time when you showed kindness to someone?

• If you could visit any place in the world, where would you go and why?

• What’s a skill you would like to learn or improve?

• Can you share a fun fact about yourself with the class?

• What’s your favorite thing to do during recess or free time?

• What’s something that challenged you recently and how did you overcome it?

Questions for Fourth and Fifth Grade

Upper elementary students can engage with questions that encourage deeper thinking and reflection:

• What’s one goal you have for yourself this week?

• If you could invent something to make the world a better place, what would it be?

• What’s your favorite season and why?

• Can you tell us about a time when you worked together with someone to solve a problem?

• If you could have any career for a day, what would you choose and why?

• What’s the most exciting thing you’ve learned in school recently?

• If you could trade lives with any fictional character for a day, who would it be and why?

• What’s one thing you wish adults understood better about being a kid?

• If you could have any talent or skill instantly, what would you pick and how would you use it?

• What’s one piece of advice you would give to your future self?

Morning Meeting Questions for Middle School Students

Middle school students are navigating significant changes in their academic and social lives. Morning meeting questions for this age group should acknowledge their growing independence while providing opportunities for meaningful connection.

These questions can help middle schoolers reflect on their experiences, share their perspectives, and build relationships with peers:

• What’s something you’re looking forward to this week?

• Can you share a recent accomplishment you’re proud of?

• If you could meet any historical figure, who would it be and why?

• What’s one thing you wish you knew more about?

• Can you tell us about a book or movie that inspired you recently?

• What’s one goal you have for yourself this school year?

• What’s your favorite way to spend free time outside of school?

• Can you share a time when you had to overcome a challenge and how you did it?

• What’s something you’re passionate about and why?

• If you could travel anywhere in the world, where would you go and why?

• What’s a talent or skill you would like to develop?

• Can you tell us about a time when you made a positive difference in someone’s life?

• What’s one thing you appreciate about yourself?

• If you could switch places with someone for a day, who would it be and why?

• What’s a topic you’d like to discuss or learn more about in class?

Morning Meeting Questions for High School Students

High school students benefit from questions that acknowledge their maturity and encourage thoughtful reflection. These questions can help create meaningful discussions and build a supportive classroom environment:

• What’s one thing you’re excited about for today?

• Can you share a recent accomplishment you’re proud of, either in school or outside of it?

• If you could choose any career path, what would it be and why?

• What’s something you’re currently reading or watching that you find interesting?

• Can you share a goal you have for yourself this semester?

• What’s one thing you’ve learned recently that surprised you?

• What’s a hobby or activity you enjoy outside of school?

• Can you tell us about a challenge you’ve faced recently and how you dealt with it?

• What’s something you’re passionate about advocating for or supporting?

• If you could have dinner with any historical figure, who would it be and what would you ask them?

• What’s one thing you appreciate about your friends or classmates?

• Can you share a moment from your week that made you smile or laugh?

• What’s one skill or talent you’d like to develop further?

• If you could go back in time and give advice to your freshman self, what would it be?

• What’s a topic you’re curious to learn more about in one of your classes?

Fun Morning Meeting Questions for All Ages

Sometimes, the best way to start the day is with a question that sparks joy, laughter, or creative thinking. These fun questions can be adapted for students of any age and are perfect for creating a positive atmosphere:

• If you could have any animal as a pet, mythical or real, what would it be and why?

• What’s the silliest dream you’ve ever had?

• If you could swap lives with any character from a book or movie, who would it be and why?

• What’s your favorite joke or riddle to share with friends?

• If you could only eat one food for the rest of your life, what would it be?

• What’s the most adventurous thing you’ve ever done?

• If you could invent a new holiday, what would it be and how would we celebrate it?

• What’s the weirdest thing you’ve ever seen an animal do?

• What’s the funniest thing that happened to you this week?

• If you could travel to any fictional world from a book or movie, where would you go and why?

• What’s the best board game or video game you’ve ever played and why?

• If you could have any job in the world for a day, what would it be and why?

• What’s your favorite way to spend a rainy day?

• If you could be any cartoon character for a day, who would you be and what would you do?

• What’s the coolest invention you can think of that doesn’t exist yet?

Morning Meeting Questions to Help Kids Plan

Questions that encourage students to think about their goals and plans can help develop important executive functioning skills. These questions prompt students to consider their priorities and set intentions for the day, week, or beyond:

• What’s one important thing you need to accomplish today?

• What’s something fun you’re looking forward to doing today?

• Pick something difficult you’d like to tackle in the week/month/year ahead. What is it?

• If someone gave you $100, how much would you save? How much would you spend right away, and what would you spend it on?

• When you look back on today before you go to bed tonight, what do you hope you’ll see?

• What’s the next book you want to read?

• What is one thing you’d like to learn today?

• What school subject is challenging you the most right now, and how can you overcome the challenges?

• What’s a question that you want answered?

• How do you plan to spend time this weekend?

• What achievable goal can you set for yourself today?

• Set a goal: How many people will you sincerely compliment today?

• Do you plan to go to college? If so, do you have a school in mind?

• What kind of job do you think would make you the happiest?

• What non-school subject would you like to learn more about?

Morning Meeting Questions to Encourage Sharing

Creating opportunities for students to share their thoughts, preferences, and experiences helps build connections and develop empathy. These questions invite students to open up about themselves in a low-pressure way:

• What’s the best place you’ve ever visited?

• What’s your favorite thing about yourself?

• If you could change one thing about yourself overnight, what would it be?

• What’s your favorite smell?

• What do you like to daydream about?

• What is your favorite time of year?

• What’s your favorite holiday?

• What’s your favorite book? Movie? TV show? Song?

• If you could paint your bedroom a new color, what would it be?

• What is most worrying to you about the world right now?

• Would you like to run for president? Why or why not?

• What is your favorite genre of book?

• What’s the hardest thing about being a kid?

• Is your bedroom messy or clean?

• What’s your pet peeve?

Inspirational Morning Meeting Questions

Questions that inspire reflection and positive thinking can help students develop a growth mindset and consider their impact on the world. These questions encourage students to think about their values, dreams, and potential:

• Of everything you want to achieve, what do you think will be the hardest?

• If you could live someplace else for a year, where would it be?

• What’s your dream vacation?

• How do you help others?

• What motivates you?

• How do you make yourself do something you really don’t want to do?

• What would you like to be famous for?

• What inspirational quote do you think everyone should hear?

• Who do you most admire?

• What are you most grateful for?

• What songs or music do you listen to when you’re happy? Sad?

• What’s one thing that always makes you feel better?

• Can money buy happiness?

• What makes a good leader?

• If you could teach your classmates how to do something, what would it be?

Morning Meeting Questions to Start the Week

Monday mornings can set the tone for the entire week. These questions help students transition back to school mode and establish positive intentions for the days ahead:

• What are you planning to do during recess this week?

• What are you looking forward to this week?

• If you could have a superpower this week, what would it be and why?

• What is a goal you have for yourself this week?

• What is something you’d like to learn more about this week?

• What is something outside of school that you are looking forward to this week?

• How do you plan to relax after school this week?

• Think about a goal you have. What progress can you make toward that goal this week?

• What is a question that you have for your future self?

• What is the most memorable school event you have attended?

• If you could spend your week with one fictional character, who would it be?

• If you were the teacher this week, what is one thing you would definitely plan?

• What is your favorite thing to do during outdoor recess? What about indoor recess?

Morning Meeting Questions to End the Week

Friday morning meetings provide an opportunity for reflection on the week’s experiences and accomplishments. These questions help students process their learning and growth:

• What is something you’re proud of accomplishing this week?

• What is something that made you smile this morning or yesterday?

• What challenged you this week? How did you tackle that challenge?

• How did you solve a problem this week?

• What was the coolest thing you learned in school this week?

• What piece of advice would you give to yourself?

• What is one funny thing that happened to you this week?

• What is your favorite thing to do outside of school?

• If you could go back in time and relive one moment from this week, what would it be?

• Can you think of how someone made a difference in your life this week, or how you made a difference in someone else’s life?

• What is one thing that you appreciate about yourself?

• Do you have a funny story from this week that you want to share?

• Think about a goal you have set. What progress did you make toward that goal this week?

Would You Rather Morning Meeting Questions

“Would you rather” questions present students with two options and ask them to choose one. These questions are engaging, often humorous, and can reveal interesting aspects of students’ personalities and preferences:

• Would you rather be able to talk to animals or read people’s minds?

• Would you rather wear shoes that are two sizes too small or four sizes too big?

• Would you rather eat pancakes or waffles?

• Would you rather be the best player on a losing team or the worst player on a winning team?

• Would you rather move to Mars if we built a colony there or stay on Earth?

• Would you rather be able to fly or be invisible?

• Would you rather have a pet dinosaur or a pet alien?

• Would you rather talk to animals or read people’s minds?

• Would you rather go to school on a pirate ship or in a castle?

• Would you rather have a superpower or a million dollars?

• Would you rather be able to talk to your past self or future self?

• Would you rather time-travel or be able to teleport to anywhere in the world?

• Would you rather give a gift or get a gift?

• Would you rather have siblings or be an only child?

• Would you rather spend a day with any famous person or with your favorite fictional character?

Seasonal and Holiday Morning Meeting Questions

Incorporating seasonal themes into your morning meeting questions can help students connect with the changing world around them and build excitement for upcoming holidays and events:

Fall/Autumn Questions

• What’s your favorite fall activity?

• If you could jump into a pile of anything (not just leaves), what would it be?

• What’s your favorite fall food or drink?

• What’s the best Halloween costume you’ve ever seen or worn?

• What are you thankful for this season?

Winter Questions

• What’s your favorite winter activity?

• If you could build a snowman that came to life, what would you do together?

• What’s your favorite way to stay warm in winter?

• What’s the best gift you’ve ever given someone?

• What’s one goal or resolution you have for the new year?

Spring Questions

• What signs of spring have you noticed recently?

• If you could plant anything and have it grow overnight, what would you plant?

• What’s your favorite outdoor activity when the weather gets warmer?

• If you were a bird building a nest, what materials would you collect?

• What’s something new you’d like to try this spring?

Summer Questions

• What’s your favorite summer memory?

• If you could visit any beach in the world, where would you go?

• What’s your favorite summer treat?

• What’s one book you’d like to read this summer?

• If you could design the perfect summer day, what would it include?

Tips for Implementing Morning Meeting Questions

To make the most of your morning meeting questions, consider these practical tips:

Create a Safe and Supportive Environment

For students to feel comfortable sharing their thoughts and experiences, they need to know that their contributions will be respected. Establish clear guidelines for morning meetings that emphasize listening, respect, and kindness. Remind students that there are no wrong answers to these questions and that everyone’s perspective is valuable.

Vary Your Question Types

Keep morning meetings fresh and engaging by using different types of questions throughout the week. Mix lighthearted, fun questions with more reflective ones. Consider having themed days, such as “Would You Rather Wednesday” or “Thoughtful Thursday,” to provide structure and variety.

Provide Think Time

Give students a moment to think about their responses before sharing. This is especially important for more complex or reflective questions. You might display the question on the board as students enter the classroom, allowing them to consider their answers as they settle in.

Offer Multiple Sharing Options

Not all students are comfortable sharing in front of the whole class. Provide options such as partner sharing, small group discussions, or written responses. You might also use a “share if you wish” approach, where students can pass if they prefer not to share on a particular day.

Model Thoughtful Responses

Share your own answers to the questions, modeling the depth of reflection and honesty you hope to see from your students. This can help create a culture of openness and vulnerability in your classroom.

Follow Up and Connect

Reference students’ morning meeting responses throughout the day when relevant. This shows that you value their contributions and helps reinforce the sense of community established during the meeting.

Using Technology to Enhance Morning Meeting Questions

Technology can add an interactive element to your morning meetings and provide additional ways for students to engage with the questions:

Digital Response Tools

Platforms like Google Forms, Mentimeter, or Padlet allow students to submit responses digitally, which can then be displayed for the class to see. This can be especially helpful for questions where seeing patterns in responses is interesting (e.g., “What’s your favorite season?”).

Visual Aids

Use images, videos, or other visual prompts to accompany your questions. For example, if asking about favorite places, show images of different landscapes or locations to spark ideas.

Random Question Generators

Create a digital spinner or random question generator to select the day’s question. This adds an element of surprise and can increase student engagement.

Recording Responses

Consider recording student responses over time to create a classroom journal or time capsule. This can be a powerful way to document growth and change throughout the school year.

Morning Meeting Questions for Special Occasions

Certain days or events call for special morning meeting questions that acknowledge their significance:

First Day of School

• What are you most excited about for this school year?

• What’s one thing you hope to learn this year?

• What’s one word that describes how you’re feeling today?

• What’s something you’d like your classmates to know about you?

• What’s one question you have about our class or school?

Last Day of School

• What’s your favorite memory from this school year?

• What’s something you learned this year that surprised you?

• What are you most proud of accomplishing this year?

• What’s one thing you’ll miss about this class?

• What are you looking forward to during the break?

Student Birthdays

• What’s your favorite birthday tradition?

• If you could have any birthday cake, what kind would it be?

• What’s the best birthday gift you’ve ever received?

• If you could spend your birthday anywhere in the world, where would you go?

• What’s one way you’ve grown or changed since your last birthday?

Adapting Morning Meeting Questions for Different Learning Environments

Morning meeting questions can be adapted for various learning contexts:

Remote or Hybrid Learning

In virtual settings, consider using questions that:

• Can be answered with visual responses (thumbs up/down, holding up objects)

• Work well in chat features or digital response tools

• Connect to students’ home environments

• Acknowledge the unique challenges and opportunities of remote learning

Multi-Age Classrooms

In classrooms with students of different ages:

• Use questions with multiple layers of complexity

• Pair older and younger students for sharing

• Allow for differentiated responses based on developmental levels

• Create opportunities for older students to mentor younger ones

Special Education Settings

For students with diverse learning needs:

• Provide visual supports for questions

• Offer response options for students who may struggle with open-ended questions

• Use questions that connect to students’ interests and strengths

• Allow for alternative forms of expression (drawing, gestures, etc.)

Evaluating the Impact of Morning Meeting Questions

To ensure your morning meeting questions are effective, consider these evaluation strategies:

Observe Student Engagement

Notice which questions generate the most enthusiasm and participation. Are students eager to share? Do they build on each other’s responses? Are they making connections to previous discussions?

Gather Student Feedback

Periodically ask students which types of questions they enjoy most and which ones help them feel connected to their classmates. Consider having students suggest questions they’d like to discuss.

Track Classroom Climate

Monitor how morning meetings affect the overall classroom environment. Do you notice increased cooperation, empathy, or positive interactions throughout the day? Are students referring back to morning meeting discussions during other activities?

Reflect on Your Goals

Consider what you hope to achieve through morning meetings and whether your questions are supporting those goals. Are you building community? Developing specific skills? Encouraging reflection? Adjust your questions accordingly.

Conclusion

Morning meeting questions are powerful tools for building classroom community, developing social-emotional skills, and setting a positive tone for learning. By thoughtfully selecting questions that are appropriate for your students’ ages and needs, you can create meaningful opportunities for connection and growth.

Remember that the most effective morning meetings evolve over time, responding to students’ interests, current events, and the changing dynamics of your classroom. Be willing to try new questions, adapt your approach, and follow your students’ lead.

Whether you’re asking kindergarteners about their favorite animals, middle schoolers about their weekend plans, or high school students about their goals for the future, the key is to create a space where every student feels valued, heard, and connected. With the right questions and a supportive environment, morning meetings can become a highlight of the school day—a time when students and teachers alike come together to share, listen, and build the foundation for successful learning.

5 Actors Who Could Replace Jonathan Majors as "Kang" in the MCU

The actor was fired by Marvel Studios after being found guilty of assaulting his ex-girlfriend.

5 Actors Who Could Replace Jonathan Majors as "Kang" in the MCU

Recently, Jonathan Majors officially quit his role as Kang The Conqueror in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

This is because he was found guilty of violence against his ex-girlfriend, Grace Jabbari.

After this news broke, many fans speculated about who could replace Jonathan Majors as Kang The Conqueror in the MCU.

Denzel Washington is one of the legendary actors in the Hollywood movie industry. He is known for his exceptional acting skills and is able to play a wide variety of roles. In addition, the experience and prestige he brings as an individual also makes him linked to replace Jonathan Majors as Kang in the MCU.

Denzel Washington

Will Smith is certainly no stranger to movie lovers. The 55-year-old actor has been traveling the world of Hollywood cinema since the 1990s and is known for his many roles. His warm and comical personality is thought to make him associated with the role of Kang in the MCU who has a wise yet jovial disposition.

Will Smith

The actor who plays Black Manta in DC's Aquaman movie managed to steal the audience's attention. Apart from having a typical villain's stature in general, he is also able to play an evil and cunning villain character. This is what makes him expected to play the role of Kang.

Yahya Abdul Mateen II

In addition to Denzel Washington being linked to the role of Kang The Conqueror in the MCU, his son, John David Washington is also expected to get the role. Like his father, John David Washington has experience and ability in acting.

John David Washington
